instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message: After replacing 0084 with 005 there is picture, OS doesn't boot, ASD EFI finds no errors, is it even possible?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message:
Have you checked the strapping resistors? 
What VRAM is the board sporting? 
It sounds more like a soldering issue, but it could be VRAM straps

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message: No desire to mess with this. Only thing I can say is compare the strapping resistors like <RESISTOR>R8610</RESISTOR>/11/12/13 to a board with 0005.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B replaced 216-0810084 with 216-0810005?
threads.message:
make sure plug in the battery,otherwise it won't boot into OS.
some 84 board replaced with 005 would work fine, some needs the bios to be re-flashed
